page.title: 05RELIGIOUS OBSERVANCE
page.content: Barr is in the presbytry of Ayr and synod of Glasgow and Ayr.The Presbyterian parish church is of 17th. century origin. The minister of Barr (and Dailly) lives in the manse in the village of Dailly.Regular services are held in Barr Church throughout the year.The minister spends approx.40% of his time visiting his Barr parishoners.Once a month,as school chaplain,the minister calls at the school to meet with staff and pupils.Several times a year the pupils go to the church to perform plays,join in songs of praise and participate in many events in the Christian calendar. As there is only one church in the village the make-up of the congregation is quite varied with different faiths being quite happy to worship in a "{Community}"church.
